properties.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 7 at 3:23AM AKST until February 8 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Wind Chill
Warning, which is in effect until 6 AM AKST Saturday. The Wind
Chill Advisory is no longer in effect.

* WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 65 below occuring.

* WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast.

* WHEN...Now to 6 AM Saturday.

* OTHER IMPACTS...The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as
little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind
speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite
and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.


A Wind Chill Warning means that dangerously low wind chills with
sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more are occurring or
expected. If outdoors, cover exposed skin to prevent frostbite.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SATURDAY
